titleStmt.title: A memorable sea-fight penned and preserved by Peter VVhite one of the IIII. masters of attendance in Englands navie. (Never before now,) published for the good of Englands common-wealth, by Andrevves Burrell. Gent. Or, a narrative of all the principall passages which were trans-acted in the Downes, in the year, 1639. betweene Antonio Oquendo, Admirall of the Spanish Armado, and Martin Van Tromp, Admirall for the states of Holland. Wherein (by a similary illustration) Englands (present) sluggish navie is proved to be unservicable, and in a like condition with the Spanish fleet.
titleStmt.author: White, Peter, Master of attendance in the Navy.
Burrell, Andrewes.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. Forcet, (Septem. 4. 1649.) dwelling in Old Fish-street,

notesStmt.note: The epistle dedicatory is signed: Andrewes Burrell.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
